title: Ping MS in League of Legends
body:
Well, I have been enjoying league for quite some time now, about 2 years (not much compared to anyone else, however I recently moved from somewhere in Texas to Mexico and I'm probably gonna live here for some years so I need to get used to all the changes as well as the language and difference in culture, but what I first noticed was my 60-50 ms instantly jumped to a steady 102, I instantly bought an ethernet cable and made a port in my room to reach the modem and I liked to see I never had ping spikes or a lot of other issues such as packet loss but my ms just went down to 94 (it has actually made it soo much bearable for some reason but it is nobody near 60) and I have read online literally hundreds of articles almost everyday because I sigh when I look at my ping and remember the old ms, I seriously love league but all other games have perfect ms, I have tried everything and nothing even decreases it a bit (prob ethernet is best that's why) and also I learned (because I instantly blamed the internet provider) that my internet here in mexico is super beefy and expensive with maybe 4 times more capacity and speedthan the one I had in the U.S. so please, I am willing to do almost anything, I am NOWHERE deep in mexico, I already tried all the mexican LAN, LAS servers but they're literally worse ms and I'm glad too because I'd hate starting a new acc since my friends all play in NA, but I did make one and tried it all, please help, I need to know if there is any little thing I could do other than moving, already tried haste, new routers, stopping all downloads, QoS settings (that worked for me in U.S. but I'm guessing it didn't do anything because fo my ethernet cable).

btw hyped for the irelia rework :)

replies.body:
Hmmmm I'm pretty sure the main reason your ping spiked so much after the move is just due to how much further away from the servers you physically are. When you were in TX your connection didn't need to travel so far, which is why you're seeing higher numbers after moving further away. 

Ethernet was a great first step, and I'm glad it helped some, but this *might* be normal for being that far away. You could try hitting up our techs in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with your network logs to see if they can think of something else though!

I am currently sending them a ticket with my network logs, thanks for all the help, at least now I'll know I tried :(
I just really want to be in top condition for the {{champion:39}} rework, I want to learn her and play her as best as I can
